shut out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to deliberately not let someone join you in an activity or share your thoughts and feelings
shut out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: How can I help you if you just keep shutting me out all the time?
I felt I was being shut out from all the family’s affairs.
shut out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to prevent someone or something from entering a place
shut out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: heavy curtains that shut out the sunlight
The door closed firmly, shutting me out from the warmth inside.
shut out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to stop yourself from thinking about or noticing something, so that you are not affected by it
shut out.translation[0].definitions[2].e: People close their windows at night in a vain attempt to shut out the sound of gunfire.
She shut out memories of James.
Jenny closed her eyes and tried to shut everything out.
shut out.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to defeat an opposing sports team and prevent them from getting any points
shut out.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a game in which one team is prevented by the other from getting any points
